inclusion.criterion: Randomized Study Visit Day 1: Metformin alone Subjects will report to the CRC at approximately 7:30 AM, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours (since approximately 10:00 PM). Vital signs and a brief history will be taken upon arrival. If all forearm vein to facilitate blood sampling.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Randomized Study Visit Day 2:Co-administration of metformin with imatinib Subjects will present to the CRC after an overnight fast as previously described.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Pregnant or lactating woman (female subjects will have a urine pregnancy test at the screening visit)
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Abnormal bone marrow function (leukocyte, neutrophil, or platelet counts outside the normal range)
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: History of hypersensitivity or allergic reaction to metformin or imatinib
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient is a 63-year-old man presenting to the Emergency Department with a history of acute urinary retention in the past 2 days. Abdominopelvic CT scan revealed a large prostate and a bladder filled with urine.
